result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey L. Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:38 a.m. Defendant Stacey L. Huber in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Stacey L. Huber in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm118 and 15cm429. All parties in receipt of revocation summary in 15cm118. 
In 15cm429, plea questionnaire filed - Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Lynch/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Restitution - $339.89 plus 10% surcharge of $33.99 for  a total of $373.88.
AODA treatment and follow through.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Review Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 

In 15cm118
Court Sentence
Jail - 115 days (time served)
Jail credit - 115 days
Any outstanding court obligations are reduced to civil judgment. 

Appeal rights given in both cases. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 10:01 a.m.

1:49 p.m. Defendant Stacey L. Huber in court via video with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Stacey L. Huber in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 1:50 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:36 p.m. Defendant Stacey L. Huber in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cm255 and 15cm429. Defendant statement to lack of contact with Attorney Lynch. JA to contact PD's office. Adj. 2:39 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

1:21 p.m. Defendant Stacey L. Huber in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm429 and 14cm255. Defendant is represented by Attorney Chad Lynch.   In receipt of complaint, Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Court quashes warrant in 15cm429. 14cm255 and 14tr1522 will be taken up on 01/04/16.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
